Up a full piece, I'm willing to give it back to break the force of the attack. A draw is better than getting mated. My opponent's adavatage in position has been worth the sacrificed material throughout the game.
My opponent, by this move, decides a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush. He settles for winning back the material and taking a draw.

Draw agreed. My advantage of two Rooks against a Queen is compensated by my opponent's superior minor piece. A short, exciting game.
